body: The following feats enhance lizardfolk's natural abilities, though Aquatic Adaption can be taken by mutated or unique individuals of any race who meet the prerequisites.
name: Lizardfolk Feats

sections.body: You've developed a strange but useful quirk for your race—you can breathe underwater.
sections.name: Aquatic Adaption

sections.body: You can breathe water as well as air.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You have trained your tail into a powerful weapon, and wield it with deadly skill.
sections.name: Dangerous Tail

sections.body: You gain a tail swipe attack. If used as part of a full-attack action, the attack is made at your full base attack bonus – 5. If the tail swipe hits, it deals 1d4 points of damage (assuming you are Medium) + 1/2 your Strength modifier. If you confirm a critical hit against a target with your tail swipe, as a free action you can attempt a trip combat maneuver against that target.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You are a faster swimmer than other members of your race.
sections.name: Swift Swimmer

sections.body: Your swim speed increases by 15 feet.
sections.name: Benefit
